sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: On Thursday Djokovic was refused entry to the country and transferred to an immigration detention hotel in Melbourne, pending a review of his case.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: If the nine-time Australian Open champion fails to have his visa cancellation overturned, he could be barred from the country for up to three years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Like much of Europe, France is paying the price of the rapid spread of the highly contagious Omicron variant. Over the last week, the country has recorded an average of more than 200,000 cases per day, with over 300,000 new cases counted on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: According to the Kazakh authorities, 2,500 Russian-led troops have arrived in Almaty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: President Kasim Domartokaev requested help from the Collective Security Treaty Organization, a regional military coalition, after violence escalated between anti-government protesters and security forces in the financial capital Almaty on Wednesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Kazakh officials have insisted troops from the aliens will only be there to protect government institutions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But President Tokayev's televised address on Friday has spread concerns, as he referred to those involved in the turmoil as terrorists and bandits he had ordered the police and army to kill we've made clear that we condemn violence committed by by anyone including violence directed at the institutions of the state and and government when it comes to the csto we have questions about the nature of the request, why it came about. We're seeking to learn more about it. What's happening there is different from what's happening on Ukraine's borders. Having said that, I think one lesson of recent history is that once Russians are in your house, it's sometimes very difficult to get them to leave.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Despite the threats and the widespread internet and communications blackout, Kazakh citizens have continued to release videos of protests in Almaty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Kazakhstan's interior ministry reported 26 people have already been killed in the tumult.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: As the Kazakhstan civil unrest continues, cryptocurrency enthusiasts are closely monitoring

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: the country's bitcoin mining industry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The former Soviet republic became a major bitcoin mining hub following the Chinese crackdown on the activity last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Bitcoin mining involves the use of computers to solve extremely difficult math equations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: That helps verify bitcoin transactions and keeps the network running.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It takes a huge amount of energy to run the computers and mining companies look to set up their pools in places that can provide cheap electricity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In August, Kazakhstan accounted for more than 18% of the global Bitcoin network hash rate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But in the last number of days, the country's mining output has been wiped out due to the government shutting down the internet in an attempt to control the mass protests.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Bitcoin network is now feeling those effects, with the price of one coin slumping to multi-month lows.

sentences.sentence: In his eighth novel, the 65-year-old author uses his legendary cynicism to depict a political thriller set in a close future. 300,000 copies of his book have already been printed.
